result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:27 AM; Case called for Hearing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Defendant Terrell C Hedley in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Terrell C Hedley.  Atty. Wang provides an update; she is just waiting for digital discovery to be turned over from the State which they just received yesterday.  Atty. Wang requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days. No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
NOTE: Should have been taken in back on 08/30/2022 when the waiver of preliminary hearing occurred.
Search Warrant Executed on 09-08-2022 from Waukesha Sheriff's Department - iPhone
for Hearing on 08/30/22 Released, not in custody
Hearing on September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Terrell C Hedley appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Terrell C Hedley. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Def requesting Zoom  **Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 8/29/22  "GRANTED"
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Angela Wang
Hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Terrell C Hedley
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 2826 W Parnell Ave Apt 3, Milwaukee, WI 53221

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS. Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

4:16 PM Defendant Terrell C Hedley in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula and he appears as friend of the court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court takes a short recess at 4:20 PM. Matter recalled at 4:23 PM with the same appearances. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
